messages.messageBody:
Thanks so MUCH
I was so terrified of the chiro and I hated that popping as well (ok really I thought my neck was going to break apart!)
Thank you thank you
I was considering massage therapy cause my neck has been bothering me to no end
and NOW I have my answer
thanks!!
POD

At 08:14 PM 4/14/00 -0400, you wrote:
As everyone is talking about Chiropractic care all I think about is why not Massage Therapy, less straining on your system.  I used to go to a chiropractor but it bothered me always hearing things popping when you get adjusted.  My back had been bothering me and I decided to try massage therapy.  I will never go back to a chiropractor unless extremely needed.  I felt 10 times better after therapy and sooooo relaxed.  It changes your mood and it helps get rid of the toxins that are being held in your lymph nodes.  It also helps with headaches and even if your are sick.  There is a lot to massage therapy and I am just starting to learn all of the benefits from it.

messages.subject: Fw: [Unschooling-dotcom] birth and continual adjustments
messages.msgSnippet: As everyone is talking about Chiropractic care all I think about is why not Massage Therapy, less straining on your system.  I used to go to a chiropractor but
messages.messageBody:
As everyone is talking about Chiropractic care all I think about is why not Massage Therapy, less straining on your system.  I used to go to a chiropractor but it bothered me always hearing things popping when you get adjusted.  My back had been bothering me and I decided to try massage therapy.  I will never go back to a chiropractor unless extremely needed.  I felt 10 times better after therapy and sooooo relaxed.  It changes your mood and it helps get rid of the toxins that are being held in your lymph nodes.  It also helps with headaches and even if your are sick.  There is a lot to massage therapy and I am just starting to learn all of the benefits from it. 
 
I am not saying the chiropractic care is wrong or not needed but there are other things out there that are not so strenuous on your bodies.
 
Gayle
----- Original Message -----
From: MorelFam@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, April 12, 2000 12:48 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] birth and continual adjustments

amy,
maybe you and some others with an understanding of chiro can help me see what
the justification for birth being so traumatic is?  how can something so
natural by design cause such havoc on the system?  what did people do before
chiropractic?  i have heard this before but it has never made sense to me and
i am willing to listen...  also, why the continual adjustments?  what do we
keep doing to ourselves in the course of our days where we'd need to keep
going and going to keep getting adjusted?  i guess the thought of being so
dependent is unappealing, too.
erin
